intro: Calysericos subulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved calysericos, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. It is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and pointed, and it produces small white or yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
